fields.description:
Add the ability to restrict the access to any custom field. For example: configure a custom field to show up if a member of "jira-developers" creates an issue, but not if a member of "jira-users" creates one. 

Something similar is done by the [Custom Field Security Plugin for JIRA|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/23216].
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure custom field security/permission

fields.description:
There are several steps in my workflow.
For example:
- open
- step 1
- step 2
- step 3
- step 4
- step 5
- closed

Answer: how can I count time between "step 2" and "step 4"?
fields.summary: How to count time beetwen two issue's states

fields.description:
Sometimes developers are not happy with certain bugs other users report. Often they think some of such issues are not valid or worth fixing. Adding the facebook-style "I like it" (or don't like it) links could be interesting.

By doing so the reporters can have an idea of what developers think about the bugs they have to deal with.

A touch of humor is always welcome :)
fields.summary: Add  "I like/ don't like it" links in every issue

fields.description:
I'm looking to upgrade our instance from 3.13.x to 4.x and noticed that one of our favourite features has serverely regressed in functionality - namely the roadmap.

I want to be able to see the distribution and status of issues, for the upcoming versions - the old version of roadmap made that very easy. The new version makes it impossible!

Specifically, as well as having to pointlessly expand all the versions to see the issues, crucially I can't see all the issues in one go ( in the contentx of the roadmap ) if there are more than 50. 

This makes it impossible to see a list of all the issues for all the future versions of a project in one roadmap like view.

Is there another way - I've played a little bit with "Single Level Group By Report" but can't seem to get it to do want I want: issues by version for unshipped versions only.

This is blocking us upgrading.
fields.summary: Functional regression 3.x - 4.x
Offer search-filters management through api
Portable replication of a JIRA instance

fields.description:
I have an embedded javascript file in header-deprecated.jsp. Whenever I update the JS file, I see the updated javascript on Issue Creation page  by refreshing the page prior to JIRA 4.x. After upgrading to JIRA 4.x, I could not see any updated javascript, yet see the old javascript. 

In JIRA 4.x, it looks like the jsp file doesn't get compiled correctly with JDK1.6.0_20. While the javascript gets updated only after reboot with JDK1.6.0_18, the javascript never gets updated even after reboot with JDK1.6.0_20

Is there a way the updated javascript to be effective without rebooting jira instance with JDK1.6.0_20?

BTW, I have a prototype running on production that uses the embedded javascript.
fields.summary: updated external java script doesn't get updated after JIRA 4.x
Cancel this Request

fields.description:
The "admin" user is in the "jira-administrator" group, but does not have "browse" permission for the "Test" project. When I select this project in the administrator view and click on "Edit Project", then click on "Update" (even when not doing any changes), I get the following error message:

"You must have the browse project permission to view this project."

This behaviour is different from JIRA 3.x, therefore I think it is a bug.

Our customer (currently on 3.12.2) has a few hundred projects in their JIRA site and wants to upgrade to 4.1.2. This issue is causing a major problem for them.

I have reproduced this with a standard standalone JIRA test instance and a modified permission scheme. Please upload the attached JIRA backup. username/pw: admin/admin.
fields.summary: jira-administrator can't edit project

fields.description:
Hello,

It will be helpful if Project Administrators have the option to disable e-mail notifications when performing Issue Edit operations.

Thank you,
Boyan
fields.summary: Project Admins should have disable notifications option

fields.description:
Hello,

It will be helpful if Bulk operations can be extended with the possibility to link one issue to many issues.

Thank you,
Boyan
fields.summary: Set issue linking in Bulk Edit

fields.description:
We use Jira also to communicate incidents via email to third parties (non Jira users) and to receive tickets via email from third parties.

It is very common that those emails have several people CC:ed, however it is impossible to see that in the Jira ticket, therefore keeping every third party user in the loop is not possible.

My Suggestion: 
Add more the same information in the ticket that is displayed when sending an email. 

This is currently added when sending an email: 
"Aybora Kardes added a comment - 16.09.2010 14:13
The issue has just been emailed to: user1@foo.com, user2@bar.com, user3@foo.com, user4@bar.com, with subject: Issue with system x and content:"

But when receiving an email, currently you only see this:
"User1 added a comment - 16.09.2010 16:19"

But it would be much better like this:
"User1 added a comment - 16.09.2010 16:19
The issue has just been received via email 
From: user1@foo.com To: user2@bar.com CC: user3@foo.com, user4@bar.com with subject: '[solved] Issue with system x' and content:"
fields.summary: Ability to see all recipients (TO: and CC:) of incoming emails in a ticket.

fields.description:
I want that the tester on closing an issue must not leave the "Verified in version" custom field (of type list versions) as none. For this i mar the field as "Mandatory from the "Administration>Field Configuration" and have associated the custom field with the View Screen and the Resolve screen.

Now whenever i create an issue there is no option to mark the "verified in version(which is right), but as i enter details and click create, it says "error! Verified in version has to be set"
I dont want to set the field while creating but want it to be mandatory while resolving.
fields.summary: Custom field should be allowed to be marked optional or mandatory for different screens
Create Release Notes Via API
Show a Progress Bar when Importing/Exporting XML Backup

fields.description:
I can't restrict the visibility of an comment created via the activity stream gadget.

In our environment it is important for us to have this feature available everywhere where users are able to create comments on issues.
fields.summary: Can't set visibility on comment created via Activity Stream Gadget

fields.description:
It would be great if we can add a personnal message in the welcome page without editing the jspa page.
This message would be set in administration mode.
The message appears when users are not logged.
When users are logged, the message is not visible anymore.
fields.summary: Personnal message in Welcome page

fields.description:
I need to make reports of certain filters i configured in JIRA.
Jira helps me with the "Word" and "Full Content" views but actually, these views provide way to much data.
This reports tend to get printed, so a lot of paper is lost because of that.

It would be usefull if the full content view could be configurated in the same way the default view is configurated (the possibility to add or remove columns).
fields.summary: Configure Fields in full content view

fields.description: When trying to upload an attachment and uploading time exceeds 1 minute uploading stops giving an "Unknown error occurred uploading file." error. It is reproducible in any out of the box installation of 4.2m9, 4.2beta1 or 4.2beta2, also here in JAC.
fields.summary: Failure uploading attachments when uploading time exceeds 1 minute

fields.description:
As a Development leader/(ScrumMaster)/Testleader, I want to be able to edit sub-tasks at the same time as I change the main-task. At least on these fields (and custom fields also):
* Priority
* Release version
* deadline
* Comment
* Released date

*TEST*
Use a filter with maintasks only. (Some of the main-tasks containing subtasks). Goto Massupdate, and tick off a few tasks. Somewhere in this dialog it should be a field to tick off *Update also sub-tasks*, change for instance [Release version] this shall be updated on all tasks and connected sub-tasks  ;-))
fields.summary: Edit sub-task in same operation as the main task(s)
JIRA allows for duplicate group names

fields.description:
# Open an issue in JIRA
# Use CTRL+PageDown to switch to the next tab in FireFox
# Use CTRL+PageUp to switch to the previous tab
# Notice how the JIRA page scrolls down every time CTRL+PageDown is used. Expected behavior: page should not scroll.
fields.summary: Switching tabs causes undesired page scrolling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22282].
  {panel}

The *Description* field for creating a Dashboard doesn't allow for more than 255 characters.

The user is notified of this only after creating the dashboard.

Suggest the following improvements
* List on the page the field limits.
!Create New Dashboard - Atlassian JIRA Extranet - Special Projects.jpg|thumbnail!
* Use JavaScript to identify remaining characters & disallow form submission whilst limits are breached.
!Edit and Share Dashboard - Atlassian JIRA Extranet - Special Projects.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create New Dashboard - Description - Field length limits

fields.description: Allow rich text in version descriptions. This way the project adnminstrators can put a link on the version page to a Confluence URL containing further information on the version (e.g. Release Notes).
fields.summary: Allow rich text in version descriptions.

fields.description: I would like the capability for an issue to be assigned to multiple people at once.  This is because I want to assign tasks for documents to be reviewed concurrently by different people.  Can you add multiple (alternate) assignees with one primary assignee?
fields.summary: Add Additional Assignees
Highlight color for new drop-down menus is very pale

fields.description:
In our Jira 4.1.2 database there are a few issues that are invalid. (They're victims of Jira 3 Bulk Move bugs like JRA-18453. After a move to another project their security level is still set to the old project and thus invalid. But I'm not filing on that bug as I believe that has been fixed in Jira 4. I'm just stating this as an example of how invalid issues still live in our Jira 4.1.2).

If a user runs a JQL function that returns JiraDataType.ISSUE and the function's results hit one of these invalid issues, they expect to get all their results. If there was an invalid issue, there should be perhaps a warning message that says, "Issue ACME-8242 is invalid," and the rest of the results are returned.  Instead they get 0 results and an error message that says only, "A value provided by the function 'jqlFunction' is invalid for the field 'issue'. 

!invalid-issue.png|thumbnail!

I refer to this bug in a related JQL Improvement request, JRA-22256.
fields.summary: Allow valid issues to pass through IssueIdValidator

fields.description: The labels field is displayed when empty with "None" and an icon to click on to edit it. There is also a More Actions, Labels choice. Are both of these necessary, or could the More Actions, Labels be removed to leave more space in that drop-down? Just a thought.
fields.summary: Duplicate of labels action

Clean install produces a NoModule error that should be a warning

fields.description:
Searching issue summary using ~ will only return the exact match. This is the [part|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-CONTAINS] that need to be updated.

For example: {noformat}Project='XXX' AND summary ~ win{noformat} will only return issue that has exact match.
!scshot1.png!

So, to perform a fuzzy search that will return results with the word "win" and it's derivatives: {noformat}project = "xxx" AND summary ~"win*"{noformat}
!scshot2.png!
fields.summary: Advance Search using Fuzzy(~)  will return exact match

fields.description:
I try to build JIRA 4.1.2 from the source distribution to apply some custom patches. 

I read the documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Building+JIRA+from+Source and followed the given instructions.

It is not possible to build 4.1.2 with Maven 1, but with Maven 2.

Please update the page or let me know, how to build without any errors JIRA from scratch.
fields.summary: Unable to build JIRA 4.1.2 from source as documented
Modify Jira SOAP beans

fields.description:
It would be beneficial if the "Add Gadget" and "Edit Layout" buttons were displayed even if the user does not have a default custom dashboard defined (e.g. they are using the system dashboard or some other default dashboard). 

In this case the new dashboard wizard should be called to create a dashboard. Ideally this would happen with certain defaults for parameters such as Name (e.g. "Dashboard for USERNAME") and Start From (e.g. the default or system dashboard) so that no parameters need to be specified.

This would contribute significantly to a more uniform user experience as well as to further enhance ease of use.
fields.summary: Dashboard creation on-the-fly when none exists

fields.description:
When I use the date-picker for the due date, it generates a date like this: "15/Sep/10". 
This produces the following error: You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "15/sep/10".
The language used is "Dutch". 
When switched to english the problem is no longer there, so it has to have something to do with the language stuff.
When manually altering the "Sep" to lowercase "sep" the format is correct and passes the validation.
fields.summary: Error with generated due date

fields.description:
The symptom of the problem:
{noformat}
...
2010-09-06 12:16:09,484 WebContainer : 5 ERROR      [500ErrorPage.jsp] Exception caught in 500 page org.apache.xerces.parsers.XIncludeAwareParserConfiguration incompatible with org.apache.xerces.xni.parser.XMLParserConfiguration
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.xerces.parsers.XIncludeAwareParserConfiguration incompatible with org.apache.xerces.xni.parser.XMLParserConfiguration
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.newDocumentBuilder(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.shindig.common.xml.XmlUtil$2.initialValue(XmlUtil.java:69)
	at org.apache.shindig.common.xml.XmlUtil$2.initialValue(XmlUtil.java:66)
...
{noformat}

The plugin system fails to start and there might be problems with the dashboard. The root cause looks like the /rest/* url is not mapped to noopservlet in the {{web.xml}} file.

The problem will be solved by adding the following to web.xml which is located in <JIRA_install>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/ directory:
{noformat}
...
<!-- This is a dummy servlet mapping to trick WebSphere 6.1.0.x to push the request through the filter chain,
	         so that the REST servlet filter plugin can be properly mapped to and intercept the rest URLs
    -->
    <servlet-mapping>
        <servlet-name>noopservlet</servlet-name>
        <url-pattern>/rest/*</url-pattern>
    </servlet-mapping>
...
{noformat}

Please restart JIRA after that.
fields.summary: Problem with Dashboard in JIRA 4.1.2 with Websphere 6.1

fields.description: Right now if you have the Resolution on a transition screen, the resolution date will be updated everytime.  Even if the value has not changed. E.g Going from Resolved to Closed should not update the resolution date.
fields.summary: ResolutionDate should only be updated when the value of Resolution changes
Inlined images should show in the gallery display after clicking
Shared filter queries break when users don't have browse permissions for projects in the search query

fields.description: See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Gadgets give an unhelpful error
JIRA upgrade fail due to inconsistent SQL query case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22256].
  {panel}

*Summary*
{{IssueNavigator}} calls every instance of a JQL function's getValues() three times 
# to validate the query
# to get the query's issues
# to see if the query fits in the simple filter form [getQueryContext()]
If the JQL function has to inspect a lot of data or returns a lot data, this leads to severe performance issues unexpectedly multiply.

*Detailed Explanation*
As some Atlassians know, we wedged Mike Cannon-Brookes prototype of advanced search into our Jira 3.13 and made enhancements to search change history and all the comment fields.
I've been working to adapt what we did to work in Jira 4.

In Jira 3, this required a heavy-handed modification of the {{LuceneQueryCreator}} so that a Lucene Filter on the comment index was properly or'ed or and'ed or not'ed against the issue index. It was messy but it worked. The performance was OK as long as the user didn't have too many queries against the comment index as sub-queries. 

For Jira 4, I figured that using a JQL function to search on the comment index and then return JiraDataType.ISSUE was the cleaner way to do what we had done by hacking {{LuceneQueryCreator}} in Jira 3. The JQL function searches the comment index and returns a list of issue id's. The rest would be handled by in Jira 4's great new re-worked search system and I could encapsulate everything in a plugin.  

What I did works, but it has horrible performance.  
{{IssueNavigator}} calls every instance of the function's getValues() three times 
# to validate the query
# to get the query's issues
# to see if the query fits in the simple filter form [getQueryContext()]

This means that my comment JQL function has to search the comment index 3 times, loop 3 times through each hit on the comment index and convert it to an issue id, and then the system re-queries the issue index using those issue ids in a new search 3 times. 
In our Jira 3 implementation the comment index was searched once, converted to a Lucene Filter and then filtered once against the issue index using Lucene.  Here are averages of a couple comparisons that I did on the same machine running both Jira 3 and Jira 4
||issues||Jira 3||Jira 4||
|500|5 seconds|5 seconds|
|30000|23 seconds|190 seconds|
|100000|53 seconds|10 minutes|

(I also noticed that if an issue in the results is for some reason invalid -- for example if it fell victim to [Bulk Edit woes|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18453] -- then after the user has waited minutes to get their slow running results, instead of getting all their issues with a warning note about the invalid issues, they get zero results and an error message which doesn't indicate what went wrong.  See [invalid-issue.png|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/40814/invalid-issue.png].  I've filed a separate bug on this, JRA-22277.)

I believe *JQL needs several an improvements*
# getValues() should only be called once not 3 times per function. Perhaps wrap the call to the function in an object that holds onto the values while it gets passed from validation to query to context anaylysis. Another idea, add an isTooComplexForSimpleSearch() method to the JqlFunction interface that would negate the need to run the query for most functions
# The returning of issue id's from JqlFunction.getValues() is almost always going to lead to a poor-performance situation because whatever the function does to discover issue ids is going to be expensive. Perhaps it should be deprecated.  *Update* I also have concern for the User functions. For example, I wrote another one that returns all the users that are no longer active so that project leads can re-assign issues that are assigned to employees who no longer work at our company. This function has to loop through all the users and find which ones no longer belong to any groups. The JQL framework also runs this function three times per function call.
# -Perhaps the better alternative would be to have a JiraDataType.FILTER so that getValues would return a Lucene Filter.- _after analyzing the issue further myself, I realize that this isn't a valid suggestion_

*Update, September 15*
After studying this for a couple days, I was able to speed up our system with 4 changes:
# To stop it from looping through thousands of issues and constructing an issue for each before the query executes, I commented out the validation code in {{IssueIdValidator}}
# I modified {{IssueIdQueryFactory}} to construct an IssueIdFilter wrapped by a ConstantScoreQuery rather than a BooleanQuery with a sub-query for each issue id. This avoids the Too Many Clauses Error if the JQL function hits more than 32000 issues. This is similar to the solution that I posed in JRA-22453. See code below.
# I modified {{MultiClauseDecoratorContextFactory}} so that it only loops through the first 100 results during getQueryContext().
# To work around but not solve the problem of {{IssueNavigator}} calling each instance of a JQL function 3 times, I put a cache in my JQL issue-type functions that holds onto each instance's results for a few seconds. This consumes unnecessary memory but it's the best that I can think of short of re-writing the entire JQL call framework to hold onto the results and then pass them through validate(), executeQuery(), and getQueryContext() rather than having validate(), executeQuery(), and getQueryContext() each separately calling jqlIssueFunction.getValues().
# To avoid unneccessarily calling isCurrentQueryTooComplex(), I hacked our {{IssueNavigator.isAdvanced()}} to have a regular expression that recognizes if there's a JQL string that matches one of our nasty custom JQL issue-type functions.

With these improvements, our Jira 4 now runs faster than Jira 3!  Yay!  
New results
||issues||Jira 3||Jira 4||
|500|5 seconds|4 seconds|
|30000|23 seconds|8 seconds|
|100000|53 seconds|23 seconds|

(Digression -- another improvement request that I contemplate -- get rid of the issue index and index everything, including change history, inside the comment index)

{code:java|title=IssueIdQueryFactory.java}
    private Query createPositiveEqualsQuery(final List<QueryLiteral> rawValues)
    {
        if (rawValues.size() == 1)
        {
            return createQuery(rawValues.get(0));
        }
        else
        {
            return new ConstantScoreQuery(new IssueIdFilter(rawValues));
        }
    }
{code}
fields.summary: Performance Issue with JQL functions
Created vs Resolved Issues Report week numbers wrong outside Australia

fields.description: Currently it's not very clear as to what the tickboxes are for, or how to remove a file that you may have accidentally attached. Just a small quick description like "Untick the tickbox next to a file to prevent it being uploaded" would be great.
fields.summary: 4.2's Attach Files dialog should have a note explaining what the tickboxes do

fields.description:
The new 4.x on-form comments are great, but for a serious bit of commenting they're too small, 2-5 lines or so.  I can't find a setting for this, but even if we could tweak the expanded size it's still going to be a poor compromise.  Firefox addons like _It's all text_ provide an individual fix but a built-in solution would be better. 

What I would like is an option to pop up the comments into a big window at near full screen size.  This could use a expand button like the preview and help buttons to pop a new text box.  Another good alternative, would be + and - buttons that expand the comment size in situ.  These could be a remembered user preference.
fields.summary: Comment area expansion option
Abilty to restart JIRA service through its own interface ( i.e. Administration )

fields.description: After upgrading users consoles to windows7 and ie8, the jira website is no longer available. It looks like it has been tested against ie8, but is there a setting in windows7 that needs to be set?  Does ntlm authentication work in the new environment? (seems like this may be the problem)
fields.summary: cannot access jira after moving to windows7 and ie8

fields.description: Through a project's maturity, some components may be added, but others may go away.  I do not want the component history to go away, but I may want to archive them out or base the available components on the version.
fields.summary: Ability to archive components and/or base on version

fields.description: we are missing the postfix 'copy - ' for the summary field when cloning subtasks.
fields.summary: when cloning subtasks the summary should also contain 'copy - '

fields.description: The new Component and Affect/Fix Version lists, with its new auto-complete, are great when you have an idea of what you're looking for. There is a small problem though. If the list is too long and you are working on a small screen, there is no way to scroll down to any item outside of the viewable screen area. This is a bigger problem when trying to interact with these lists from a mobile device or when using a mouse that doesn't have a scroll wheel. I have tried navigating with the keyboard but still doesn't show up all the options within the list.
fields.summary: Long Component/Affect Version lists don't have a scroll bar to navigate through

fields.description:
As a bughunter for Second Life, I reported the following:

http://jira.secondlife.com/browse/WEB-2784

I hope you understand I don't have time to figure out the Atlasian site, so I'll just leave you with this link.
However, if you need more information, I will be happy to help.
fields.summary: JIRA4: Firefox doesn't display the entire page when there are many comments

fields.description:
Hi,
I was wondering if there is an option to link JIRA bug with a backlog item. If a bug related to a backlog item is not resolved and in open state, user should not be able to close the backlog item. Is that capability present in JIRA? If not, is it possible to implement? This option will help us to control the backlog items with bugs associated to them. 

Regards,
Srini
fields.summary: Dependency between a bug and backlog item

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# {{Browse >> Project >> Road Map}}
# Click on the version to view the issues
# CTRL + left click on the issue

The above steps should be able to open a new tab for the issue but it is not working. After the page is refreshed, then only the "CTRL + left click" is working. However, after refreshed, if other Version is click to view the issue, "CTRL + left click" is not working also. "CTRL + left click" will be able to work if the version is clicked to view the issues and then the page is refreshed. This is happening to JIRA 4.0.x and 4.1.x
fields.summary: Ctrl + Left-click not working in Road Map page using Firefox

fields.description: Translate option missing while clicked on the Issue types scheme tab or translate tab in Administration>Issue Settings>Issue Types.
fields.summary: Translate option missing in Issue setting > issue types

fields.description:
When browsing a project, users are currently presented with a default set of filters on each of the project tabs. For example, on the Summary tab, there are Issues Due, Issues 30 Day Summary, Activity Stream, Issues Updated Recently, etc.; and on the Issues tab, there are Unresolved by Priority, Unresolved by Assignee, Status Summary, etc. These filters are the defaults, as programmed by Atlassian, and can't easily be changed. 

I think it would be a very useful improvement to allow either the JIRA administrator or the individual project administrator to choose which filters to display and which filters to hide on each of the project panel tabs. They should be able to choose from a list of standard filters, but should also be able to easily create new filters to include (for example) custom fields. It should not require a programmer to do this.

Example A: the JIRA admin might configure the system so that on ALL projects, the Summary tab will display Issues Closed Recently instead of Issues Updated Recently.
Example B: on one particular project, the project admin might configure it so that the Issues tab will show Unresolved Issues by Type instead of Unresolved by Component, and Unresolved Issues by Severity (a custom field).
fields.summary: Ability to change the filters shown on the various tabs of the project panel
Provide a Download Attachment function to JIRA SOAP API
Deprecate EAR-WAR guides and document migration path

fields.description: We currently extract JIRA data in excel file. So far it is working very well, but we would like to add a column where we can get the latest JIRA case comments in one of the columns as well. Can this be done? Currently, we have to copy/paste the latest comments into the excel file manually (column "A", which is very cumbersome and inefficient process.
fields.summary: How to get JIRA extacts with the latest comments

fields.description: Workflow schemes names should be able to be edited when the workflow scheme is active. We have a few Workflow Schemes that we would like to rename but we can't because they are assigned to too many projects. We would need to create a copy, rename the copy and reassign all projects to this new Workflow Scheme.
fields.summary: Edit name for Workflow Schemes

fields.description:
The documentation on [Velocity Context for the email template|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA040/Velocity+Context+for+Email+Templates] has "security" in the Velocity Variable column instead of "securityLevel".

This does not match the velocity file \atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\templates\email\text\includes\issuesummary.vm which is using "securityLevel".
fields.summary: Velocity Context for Email Templates documentation is outdated

fields.description:
Basically, the design of the lock file affects more customers than it should. If JIRA hangs or the shutdown script doesn't work correctly, a lock file is left in the home directory. What's worse, it's a system file, which makes it difficult to find (the documentation is hard to find and too difficult. 

For a justification, go to Google and type in "jira is " to see the recommendations (include the space). You'll see that "Jira is locked" and "jira is already locked". It's a common search. Many customers are likely to be finding the solution via google, but we should prevent the issue in the first place by redesigning the locking mechanism.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Lock file mechanism

fields.description:
I've noticed recently that when doing a quick search for an issue, that if the search phrase contains a word/phrase that's the same as one of the "Resolution" issue attributes, that word is removed from the search phrase (Query string) and used as the Resolution type.

For instance, searching for an issue with the title "duplicate meta content" gets me a search result with the Resolution type as "Duplicate", and the search Query is just "meta content"

I've tested this with other Resolution type words in the search phrase, and with the word(s) in different parts of the search phrase (like: "meta content duplicate"), and get the same result.

The same thing happens if a word from "Issue Type" or "Priorities" is in the search phrase (like: "meta content bug" gets a search query for "meta content" and Issue type: Bug, and "meta content critical" returns a search for the query "meta content" with the issue Priority being Critical)

AND: if you put a word from more than one of the above filter types into a search, they BOTH get taken out and used for the filters, such as with a search for "duplicate bug meta content".
fields.summary: Words from quick search query strings end up as filter types

fields.description:
When creating a link between 2 issues, 2 different activity feed items are created to represent the change to both issues. 

This is non-ideal behavior because: a) linking is only 1 action  b) 2 activity items show nearly identical information and are therefore redundant.  

A link action should create only 1 activity item.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. link 2 issues
2. view activity feed

Expected:
One entry will show the linking action performed

Actual:
2 different entries exist showing the linking action relative to each issue
fields.summary: linking action should create 1 activity item, rather than 2
Projects gadged on dashboard causes "Internal Server Error" with empty project description

fields.description:
1. Typo: "is a cloned of" is not correct. Should be "is a clone of".
2. Some of the dropdowns make complete sentences e.g. "is a duplicate of", while some do not e.g. "caused by". It should be consistent. 
* is caused by
* causes
* is cloned by
* is a clone of
* duplicates
* is duplicated by
* relates to
* is related to
* is a requirement of
* has a requirement of
fields.summary: Link Issue Typos and Inconsistencies

fields.description:
When exporting to XML the Issue Navigator, the values of custom fields of type "Cascading Select" do not appear with the right values. They come populated with IDs instead.

Here is an example:
{code}
<customfield id="customfield_10090" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:cascadingselect">
  <customfieldname>System</customfieldname>
  <customfieldvalues>
    <customfieldvalue key="">10060</customfieldvalue>
    <customfieldvalue key="1">10061</customfieldvalue>
  </customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
{code}
fields.summary: XML export does not display cascading select-list values properly

fields.description:
The text "Fix Versions/s" on issues is ambiguous.

It could mean "Version/s to be fixed".

I suggest changing the text to:

"Fixed in Version/s"

which is less ambiguous.
fields.summary: "Fix Versions/s" is ambiguous

fields.description:
Login to JIRA.
Select "Administration" link, displays following page:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa

The top of this page says:

"Administration

Below is the list of all 44 projects for this installation of JIRA."

However, this is not correct. The page does *not* show all projects in the installation of JIRA. It only shows the projects in the installation for which the login has administrative rights.
fields.summary: Misleading text on Administration screen

fields.description:
The filter that use JQL to search issue will break if the Issue Settings (Issue Types, Priorities, Resolutions, Statuses) are renamed. 
For example:
Filter with JQL {{project = TST AND (issuetype = Bug OR issuetype = Task)}} will break if the Issue Type *Bug* is renamed to *Bugs* and the error message below is displayed:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|bgColor=#FF9999}
The value 'XYZ' does not exist for the field 'FieldName'.
{panel} 
!JQL_filter.png!
fields.summary: JQL filters break if the Issue Settings are renamed
"JIRA: News" Gadget Icon hosted by http url scheme, which produce unsecure content warnings when gadget directory dialog appears

fields.description:
Hello, 
For new users not clear how to get an account: on the login page there is no link or explanation how to register, the way the  access provided etc. It would be nice to have a direct link to guidance how to creat an account/register and to access the project of interest.
fields.summary: How to sign up

fields.description:
JIRA will throw System Error if 'Hours per day' is set with a value than contain decimal when user want to generate the Time Sheet Report.

Here are the steps to reproduce the problem:
# set the *Hours per day* via _Administration > Global Settings > Time Tracking_ to *7.5*.
# create a project
# go to the _Projects > select the newly created project > click on Reports >_ select *Time Sheet Report*
# select any Start Date,End Date,User and click on the "Next" button.
# JIRA will throw System Error which contain the following Stack Trace:
{noformat}
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "7.5"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:458)
	at java.lang.Integer.<init>(Integer.java:660)
	at com.fdu.jira.util.TextUtil.<init>(TextUtil.java:43)
	at com.fdu.jira.plugin.report.timesheet.TimeSheet.generateReport(TimeSheet.java:454)
	at com.fdu.jira.plugin.report.timesheet.TimeSheet.generateReportHtml(TimeSheet.java:472)
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA can't produce TimeSheet Report if the  Hours per day value has decimal

fields.description:
After renaming a status, the displayed name of the same status in already existing workflows stays the same.

I simply added some new statuses, started to define a custom workflow and renamed later one of the used statuses. Nevertheless the displayed status name in the workflow stays the same. Only after restarting JIRA, the statuses are displayed correctly.
fields.summary: In Workflow used status is not updated after renaming the status itself

fields.description: view an issue page with many comments, scroll to the bottom, then scroll to the top, the issue header and buttons have now disappeared.
fields.summary: Issue buttons disappear on view issue screen with iPad.

fields.description:
The dialogs in the Issue Navigator that are invoked when using keyboard shortcuts only display the issue key rather than both the key and the issue summary.

Depending on which dialog you're using and how big the browser window is, you can end up with the issue names obscured behind the dialog and you're not sure which issue it is you're performing actions on. See attached screenshot for an example.

It'd be nice to add the summary to the dialogs (even if just the first part of the summary and snip the end of it, so overly long summaries don't break the dialogs).
fields.summary: Dialogs should display issue summary, not just key

fields.description:
Hi,

Can JIRA have the ability to create a filter with WORKLOG stats, like the STARTDATE field that references TIMEWORKED field? For more reference, here's the customer support request: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-64035

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Filter using WORKLOG details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22214].
  {panel}

This is a clone of JRA-18493 which was resolved as fixed. 

During an upgrade from Jira 3.13 to Jira 4.1.2 two re-indexes occur, one for Build 440 and one for Build 518.   
Please reduce this to one if at all possible.

On a system with many issues, like 200000, this double re-indexing consumes 2 hours of site down time instead of 1 hour. 
In our upgrade from Jira 3.13 to 4.1.2, we need to manually re-index a third time as we have dropped and then re-added a custom calculated field that changed due to changes in the Jira API.
fields.summary: CLONE - Remove any re-index from the JIRA 4.1 upgrade tasks that's not needed

fields.description:
Is it possible to enhance the viewing of "file attachments" on the view issue screen.

In particular, I would like to be able to see the author and datetimestamp on the view issue screen. I would also like the files to be sorted in date descending order as default.

In addition to this, it would be beneficial to have some versioning logic. I.e. If I upload a file called "123ABC.doc" then subsequently upload a file with the same name, I would like to be able to keep the original file and for JIRA to automatically modify the new filename to be "123ABC(01).doc" for instance.

Is this available via a plugin or would it require dev?
fields.summary: View attachments enhancements

fields.description:
Hi,

Can JIRA have the ability to create (and, for all purposes) work with usernames with uppercase letters?

You 'can' update the username directly into the database, but when you try to, for example, create a filter, and search for the username with case sensitivity, it will result no items, and if you just lowercase all the username, it will show results.
fields.summary: Uppercase usernames

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22209].
  {panel}

Configuration screen for Backup Service doesn't provide any explanation for the configuration options for 'Date format'.

!BackupService.png!

We should extend the provided description for commonly used pattern. Also, add this information in our documentation.

Currently, supported patterns are listed at http://download-llnw.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html
fields.summary: Extend info about cofiguration options for backup service

fields.description:
Currently, Managed Filters lists filters shared with 'Everyone' without authentication (e.g. [SAC's one|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/ManageFilters.jspa].

Despite that this functionality operates correctly and according to design we should consider improving the current implementation.

It looks like for some users the consequences of sharing filters with 'Everyone' is not so obvious.

Perhaps, better messaging on the Share filter page and emphasise on the effect of this configuration option.

!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729481/jira-4_1-issue_filters-savefilter.png?version=3&modificationDate=1268285823444!

Alternatively, we could empower administrators to control access to the Everyone option on the application level (private mode or general configuration).
fields.summary: Add warning to Shared Filter explaining consequence of 'everyone'
Priority should be displayed in text email notification even if it is not the system default
Hyperlink in description field

fields.description: Some of the components such as <rich:tree and the <rich:dropdown do not support right alignment needed for Right to Left languages such as arabic.
fields.summary: Right to Left optimizations for Arabic locale

fields.description:
JIRA 4.2 will have issue linking turned on by default and it will also have the following default link types:

clones / is cloned by
relates to / relates to
duplicates / is duplicated by
blocks / is blocked by

Note that these link types and the fact that issue linking is enabled are both only effected when starting JIRA from scratch with no data. If you upgrade, you don't get any change to your existing issue links or issue linking status, even if it is untouched from a prior default.
fields.summary: Document Issue Linking admin changes (READY TO PUBLISH)

fields.description:
We want new users to see all the features of JIRA from day one.

Also we want clone links to be present since so they are present ready for cloning.
fields.summary: Add Turn On Issue Link Types by default and add some default values
typo in "Date Range Selector" screen: first line of help text should end with a full-stop instead of comma.

fields.description: As the administrator of a project, I should be able to manage components when selecting a project from the Projects dropdown > Components tab. This type of management is already available for versions.
fields.summary: As the administrator of a project, I should be able to manage components when selecting a project from the Projects dropdown then selecting the Components tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22195].
  {panel}

In the Solaris environment, the 32bit version of the JRE/JDK is the baseline and the 64bit is either a sparcv9 on a SPARC chip or an amd64 on an x86 chip (i.e. intel or amd).

All the scripts that would called the JVM are using
 $JAVA_HOME/bin/java (i.e. the 32bit)  instead of the $JAVA_HOME/bin/amd64/java (i.e. the 64bit). 

Since the application (i.e. Jira) and/or the application server that it sits on (i.e. Tomcat) can not determine the instruction set (i.e. 64 vs 32), then setting the JAVA_HOME to the JDK home is  not enough.
fields.summary: setting the JAVA_HOME to the JDK home is not enough on Solaris 10 x86/64bit

fields.description:
description:
the field RemoteConfiguration.timeTrackingHoursPerDay within the soap wsdl is of type 'int' but it is possible to enter double values like '7.5' within Global Settings/Time Tracking/Hours per day. This will lead to a NumberFormatException

to reproduce:
1. Go to Global Settings/Time Tracking and enable it
2. Change the 'Hours per day' value to '7.5' (decimal is important!)
3. click Activate
4. build a soap client and request JiraSoapService.getServerInfo(<token>)

this will lead to the following exception:
AxisFault
 faultCode: {http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Server.userException
 faultSubcode: 
 faultString: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "7.5"
 faultActor: 
 faultNode: 
 faultDetail: 
	{}faultData:null
	{http://xml.apache.org/axis/}hostname:blackbook.local

java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "7.5"
	at org.apache.axis.message.SOAPFaultBuilder.createFault(SOAPFaultBuilder.java:222)
	at org.apache.axis.message.SOAPFaultBuilder.endElement(SOAPFaultBuilder.java:129)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DeserializationContext.endElement(DeserializationContext.java:1087)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLNSDocumentScannerImpl.scanEndElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:395)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DeserializationContext.parse(DeserializationContext.java:227)
	at org.apache.axis.SOAPPart.getAsSOAPEnvelope(SOAPPart.java:696)
	at org.apache.axis.Message.getSOAPEnvelope(Message.java:435)
	at org.apache.axis.handlers.soap.MustUnderstandChecker.invoke(MustUnderstandChecker.java:62)
	at org.apache.axis.client.AxisClient.invoke(AxisClient.java:206)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invokeEngine(Call.java:2784)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2767)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2443)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2366)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:1812)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.generated.JirasoapserviceV2SoapBindingStub.getConfiguration(JirasoapserviceV2SoapBindingStub.java:4130)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraUpdater.updateTimeTrackingSettings(OpJiraUpdater.java:746)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraUpdater.getWorkHoursPerDay(OpJiraUpdater.java:768)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraServiceImpl.getEffort(OpJiraServiceImpl.java:399)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraServiceImpl.updateRequirementSettings(OpJiraServiceImpl.java:360)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraServiceImpl.requirementAdded(OpJiraServiceImpl.java:178)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraUpdater.addRequirement(OpJiraUpdater.java:317)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraUpdater.updateProject(OpJiraUpdater.java:279)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraUpdater.updateProject(OpJiraUpdater.java:230)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.jira.OpJiraUpdater.updateProject(OpJiraUpdater.java:159)
	at onepoint.project.team.modules.product.OpProductAdvancedService.insertOrUpdateProduct(OpProductAdvancedService.java:164)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at onepoint.service.server.XService.callJavaMethod(XService.java:93)
	at onepoint.project.OpProjectService.callJavaMethod(OpProjectService.java:220)
	at onepoint.service.server.XService.invokeMethod(XService.java:49)
	at onepoint.service.server.XSession.invokeMethod(XSession.java:128)
	at onepoint.express.server.XExpressSession.invokeMethod(XExpressSession.java:79)
	at onepoint.service.server.XBinaryServlet.processRequest(XBinaryServlet.java:189)
	at onepoint.project.servlet.OpOpenServlet.processRequest(OpOpenServlet.java:602)
	at onepoint.service.server.XBinaryServlet.doPost(XBinaryServlet.java:139)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:637)
	at onepoint.project.servlet.OpOpenServlet.service(OpOpenServlet.java:152)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:511)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.handle(ServletHandler.java:390)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.SessionHandler.handle(SessionHandler.java:182)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandler.handle(ContextHandler.java:765)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.HandlerCollection.handle(HandlerCollection.java:114)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.HandlerWrapper.handle(HandlerWrapper.java:152)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.Server.handle(Server.java:326)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handleRequest(HttpConnection.java:542)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection$RequestHandler.content(HttpConnection.java:938)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseNext(HttpParser.java:842)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseAvailable(HttpParser.java:212)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handle(HttpConnection.java:404)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.bio.SocketConnector$Connection.run(SocketConnector.java:228)
	at org.mortbay.thread.QueuedThreadPool$PoolThread.run(QueuedThreadPool.java:582)

solution:
change timeTrackingHoursPerDay to be of type double
fields.summary: NumberFormatException when requesting JiraSoapService.getConfiguration(token) if eg Hours per day is set to 7.5
